global.helptext: This is the input file for CONREP describing the configurable settings for the ProLiant servers listed below. Other models require platform specific configuration files that are available on hp.com.

Section.name: OS
Section.helptext: Installed OS

Section.name: IMD_ServerName
Section.helptext: LCD Display name for this server

Section.name: IMD_ServerAssetTag
Section.helptext: Asset tag string as entered in RBSU

Section.name: IMD_ServerPrimaryOS
Section.helptext: Free text to describe OS installation

Section.name: IMD_ServerMiscInfo
Section.helptext: Free text strings for information on this server

Section.name: IMD_AdminName
Section.helptext: Free text to identify the server administrator

Section.name: IMD_AdminPhone
Section.helptext: Free text describing the administrator phone number

Section.name: IMD_AdminPager
Section.helptext: Free text to contain the administrator pager info

Section.name: IMD_AdminMisc
Section.helptext: Free text field

Section.name: IMD_AdminEmail
Section.helptext: Administrator E-mail Address

Section.name: IMD_ServiceName
Section.helptext: Free text describing the service name for this server

Section.name: IMD_ServicePhone
Section.helptext: Free text for server phone information

Section.name: IMD_ServicePager
Section.helptext: Free text describing the service pager number

Section.name: IMD_ServiceMisc
Section.helptext: Free text with any additional service information

Section.name: IMD_ServiceEmail
Section.helptext: Service Contact E-mail Address

Section.name: IMD_UserDefinedName
Section.helptext: User defined information for the display LCD

Section.name: IMD_UserDefinedMenu
Section.helptext: User defined information for the display LCD

Section.name: IMD_UserDefinedSubMenu
Section.helptext: User defined information for the display LCD

Section.name: IPL_Order
Section.helptext: Current Initial ProgramLoad device boot order.

Section.name: IPL_Order_Size
Section.helptext: Current Initial ProgramLoad device boot order size.

Section.name: PCI_Devices
Section.helptext: Lists of PCI devices and their interrupts - not displayed if default values are set.

Section.name: Controller_Order
Section.helptext: Lists the current boot controller ordering.

Section.name: Language
Section.helptext: Defines current language identifier

Section.name: System_WOL
Section.helptext: System Wake On Lan Capabilities.

Section.name: System_APIC
Section.helptext: System APIC Settings(MPS Table Mode).

Section.name: System_Mouse
Section.helptext: Enable or Disable the onboard mouse port.

Section.name: System_CPU_Serial_Number
Section.helptext: Enables or disabled CPU serial numbers on systems that support it.

Section.name: System_COMA
Section.helptext: Settings for UART 1 on systems that support it.

Section.name: System_COMA_IRQ
Section.helptext: Settings for UART 1 on systems that support it.

Section.name: System_COMB
Section.helptext: Settings for UART 2 on systems that support it.

Section.name: System_COMB_IRQ
Section.helptext: Settings for UART 2 on systems that support it.

Section.name: System_Virtual_Serial_Port
Section.helptext: Virtual Serial Port Settings for systems that support it.

Section.name: System_Virtual_Serial_Port_IRQ
Section.helptext: Virtual Serial Port IRQ Settings for systems that support it.

Section.name: System_LPT
Section.helptext: System parallel port settings for systems that support it.

Section.name: System_LPT_IRQ
Section.helptext: System parallel port settings for systems that support it.

Section.name: System_LPT_Mode
Section.helptext: System parallel port settings for systems that support it.

Section.name: System_USB_Control
Section.helptext: Systemwide USB settings.

Section.name: System_USB_EHCI_Controller
Section.helptext: Enables or disabled EHCI mode(USB 2.0) of the system USB controller.

Section.name: Diskette_Write_Control
Section.helptext: Toggles write control of integrated floppy.

Section.name: POST_F1_Prompt
Section.helptext: For Gen9 servers, Delayed is Delayed 20 seconds. Controls display of the F1 POST prompt.

Section.name: Hyperthreading
Section.helptext: Toggles hyperthreading on systems that support it. This setting is supported on G5 and earlier systems. For newer systems, use the Intel_Hyperthreading setting.

Section.name: NMI_Debug_Button
Section.helptext: Allows generating NMI(non-maskable interrupt) via NMI button/jumper for hardware debugging.

Section.name: ACPI_Power_Button
Section.helptext: Switches power button to operate in APCI mode. Enabling permits enhanced power button handling(push and hold to shut off, and single push to shutdown) instead of on/off operation.

Section.name: CPU_Performance
Section.helptext: Allows tuning of system performance goals

Section.name: ASR
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling of the Automatic Server Recovery feature.

Section.name: ASR_Timeout
Section.helptext: User Configuration Timeout for Automatic Server Recovery

Section.name: Thermal_Shutdown
Section.helptext: Enables shutdown when thermal events occur

Section.name: Custom_Post_Message
Section.helptext: Customized message to be displayed on the screen during POST

Section.name: RBSU_Language
Section.helptext: Language to use for the RBSU menus

Section.name: PXE_NIC1
Section.helptext: Enable or disable PXE boot on the given NIC

Section.name: PXE_NIC2
Section.helptext: Enable or disable PXE boot on the given NIC

Section.name: PXE_NIC3
Section.helptext: Enable or disable PXE boot on the given NIC

Section.name: PXE_NIC4
Section.helptext: Enable or disable PXE boot on the given NIC

Section.name: PXE_NIC5
Section.helptext: Enable or disable PXE boot on the given NIC

Section.name: BIOS_Console
Section.helptext: Used to select the port for the BIOS console

Section.name: BIOS_Baud_Rate
Section.helptext: BIOS console communications settings

Section.name: BIOS_Type
Section.helptext: Terminal Emulation Mode of BIOS Serial Console

Section.name: EMS_Console
Section.helptext: Used to select the port for the EMS console

Section.name: BIOS_Interface_Mode
Section.helptext: BIOS console communications settings

Section.name: SAN_Boot_Controller_Order
Section.helptext: Enables default boot from SAN on systems that support it

Section.name: SAN_Boot_Embedded_Controller
Section.helptext: SAN Boot option for systems that support it

Section.name: System_Embedded_IDE
Section.helptext: Settings for the embedded IDE controller on systems that support it

Section.name: Embedded_Virtual_Disk
Section.helptext: Enables or disable the Virtual Disk when available.

Section.name: Virtual_Install_Disk
Section.helptext: Controls the Virtual Install Disk. The Virtual Install Disk may contain drivers specific to this server that an OS may use during installation..

Section.name: HP_Power_Regulator
Section.helptext: Allows tuning of the system power usage

Section.name: HW_Prefetch
Section.helptext: System performance tuning entry

Section.name: Adjacent_Sector_Prefetch
Section.helptext: System performance tuning entry

Section.name: ATA_Drive_Write_Cache
Section.helptext: Enables the write cache on attached ATA disks

Section.name: Embedded_SATA_Configuration
Section.helptext: Sets the mode for the embedded SATA controller. Set RAID mode to enable B120i,B320i,and B140i controllers.

Section.name: HP_Dynamic_Smart_Array_RAID_Controller
Section.helptext: Enables RAID mode on the following controllers: B320i. Use Embedded_SATA_Configuration section for the following controllers: B120i.

Section.name: BIOS_Enhanced_RAID
Section.helptext: Enables enhanced RAID mode

Section.name: No_Execute_Memory_Protection
Section.helptext: Enables No Execute mode if the system CPU supports it

Section.name: CPU_Virtualization
Section.helptext: When enabled, a Virtual Machine Manager supporting this feature can utilize hardware capabilities provided by the server.

Section.name: Embedded_NIC
Section.helptext: This setting allows the configuring of network controllers in the server. 0 - Disabled, 1 - Network Boot, 2 - iSCSI

Section.name: Memory_Protection
Section.helptext: Sets the type of memory protection used on the server. Not all modes are supported on all servers.

Section.name: Advanced_Memory_Protection_Gen8
Section.helptext: Sets the type of memory protection used on the server. Not all modes are supported on all servers.

Section.name: Memory_Online_Spare_Mode
Section.helptext: Enables Memory Online Spare when the Advanced Memory Protection setting is set to Online Spare with Advanced ECC. AMD Servers only.

Section.name: Automatic_Poweron
Section.helptext: For G7 and earlier only. Configures server to automatically power on when A/C power is applied to the system. This setting is not support by blade servers.

Section.name: Automatic_Poweron_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8 and later. Configures server to automatically power on when A/C power is applied to the system. This setting is not support by blade servers.

Section.name: Power-On_Delay
Section.helptext: Sets the delay for the system to be begin the boot up process

Section.name: PCI_Enumeration_Method
Section.helptext: Controls the PCI enumeration method on G6 servers. Supported on G6 servers only.

Section.name: RCMODE
Section.helptext: Sets the mode for the Remote Console.

Section.name: Asset_Tag_Protection
Section.helptext: When set to Locked, the Asset tag will not be erased if default system settings are restored.

Section.name: Shared_ILO_Port
Section.helptext: Switches iLo from using its dedicated NIC port to sharing the first NIC of the system for ML310 G5.

Section.name: Option_ROM_Loading_Sequence
Section.helptext: Choses whether Option ROMs for embedded devices or expansion cards are loaded first.

Section.name: Removable_Flash_Media_Boot_Sequence
Section.helptext: Selects which USB or SD card devices will be searched first when enumerating boot devices.

Section.name: USB_Port_Boot_Order_G5
Section.helptext: Allows the USB Port Boot order to be set on G5 or older systems.

Section.name: USB_Port_Boot_Order_G6
Section.helptext: Allows the USB Port Boot order to be set on G6 or newer systems.

Section.name: USB_Boot_Support
Section.helptext: Supported on Gen8 only. This option allows the user to prevent the system from booting all USB devices connected to the server. This option will also disable booting iLO virtual media.

Section.name: Low_Power_Halt_state
Section.helptext: Allows the enable/disable of the Low Power Halt state(C1E).

Section.name: Intel_Processor_Core_Disable
Section.helptext: Allows disabling of processor cores using Intel's Core Multi-Processing(CMP) technology.

Section.name: Intel_Processor_Turbo_Mode
Section.helptext: Allows Intel processors to transition to a higher frequency than its rated speed if the processor has available headroom and is within temperature specification.

Section.name: Intel_VT-d2
Section.helptext: When enabled, a Virtual Machine Manager supporting this feature can utilize hardware capabilities provided by Intel's Virtualization Technology for Directed I/O.

Section.name: HP_Power_Profile
Section.helptext: Selects the level of power versus performance for the system.

Section.name: Intel_QPI_Link_Power_Management
Section.helptext: Places the Quick Path Interconnect (QPI) links into a low power state to save power.

Section.name: Intel_QPI_Link_Frequency
Section.helptext: This option allows the user to set the QPI Link frequency to a lower speed. Running at a lower frequency may reduce power consumption but may also impact system performance.

Section.name: Intel_Minimum_Processor_Idle_Power_State
Section.helptext: Selects the lowest idle power state (C-state) the OS will use. The higher the C-state, the lower the power usage. C6 is the lowest power idle state supported. For G6/G7/Gen8 BIOS 05/05/2011 or later, this is the Power Core State.

Section.name: Intel_Minimum_Processor_Idle_Power_Package_State
Section.helptext: Selects the lowest idle power package state (C-state). On Gen8 and later servers, Package C3 State corresponds to Package C6(non-retention) State in RBSU.

Section.name: Maximum_Memory_Bus_Frequency
Section.helptext: Configures memory system to run memory at a lower maximum speed than what is supported by the installed processor and DIMM configuration. Setting to Auto configures max speed supported.

Section.name: Memory_Interleaving
Section.helptext: Modifies the level of interleaving for which the memory system will be configured. Typically, higher levels of memory interleaving result in maximum performance, but reducing interleaving level may result in power savings.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Generation_20_Support
Section.helptext: For Gen8 and Gen9 servers, this is the same as Intel Maximum PCI Express Speed. Force_PCI-E_Generation_2 is the same as Maximum Supported on Gen8. For Gen 9, Auto is the same as Maximum Supported.

Section.name: Thermal_Configuration
Section.helptext: Selects the fan cooling solution for the system(not for ML350 G6).

Section.name: Thermal_Configuration_ML350_G6
Section.helptext: Selects the fan cooling solution for the ML350 G6 server.

Section.name: Intel_TPM_Functionality
Section.helptext: For Intel G7. This option allows the enabling of the Trusted Platform Module and BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: Intel_TPM_Visibility
Section.helptext: For Intel G7. This option provides the ability to hide the TPM from the operating system.

Section.name: Intel_TPM_Expansion_ROM_Measuring
Section.helptext: For Intel G7. This option allows enabling the BIOS to measure the PCI/PCI-e expansion (Option) ROM code and store that measurement into the TPM.

Section.name: AMD_TPM_Functionality
Section.helptext: For AMD G7. This option allows the enabling of the Trusted Platform Module and BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: AMD_TPM_Visibility
Section.helptext: For AMD G7. This option provides the ability to hide the TPM from the operating system.

Section.name: AMD_TPM_Expansion_ROM_Measuring
Section.helptext: For AMD G7. This option allows enabling the BIOS to measure the PCI/PCI-e expansion (Option) ROM code and store that measurement into the TPM.

Section.name: TPM_Functionality_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8. This option allows the enabling of the Trusted Platform Module and BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: TPM_Visibility_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8. This option provides the ability to hide the TPM from the operating system.

Section.name: TPM_Expansion_ROM_Measuring_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8. This option allows enabling the BIOS to measure the PCI/PCI-e expansion (Option) ROM code and store that measurement into the TPM.

Section.name: TPM_12_Functionality_Gen9
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. This option allows the enabling of the TPM 1.2 and BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: TPM_12_Visibility_Gen9
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. This option provides the ability to hide the TPM 1.2 from the operating system.

Section.name: TPM_Binding_Gen9
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. Use this option to bind the TPM module to the system board by using a value that is unique to each server board.

Section.name: TPM_UEFI_Option_ROM_Measurement_Gen9
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. Use this option to enable measuring the UEFI PCI option ROMs. Disabling this option skips measuring the UEFI PCI option ROMs.

Section.name: TPM_20_Functionality
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. This option enables you to reset TPM to factory settings, which clears any assigned passwords, keys, or ownership data.

Section.name: TPM_20_Physical_Presence_Confirmation
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. This option allows the masking of physical presence of TPM 2.0.

Section.name: TPM_20_Visibility
Section.helptext: For Gen9 or later. This option provides the ability to hide the TPM 2.0 from the operating system which in turn disables BIOS secure startup.

Section.name: Node_Interleaving
Section.helptext: Allows the enabling/disabling of node interleaving on Intel platforms.

Section.name: Intel_Hyperthreading
Section.helptext: Toggles hyperthreading on Intel based G6 and greater systems

Section.name: AMD_RevF_Node_Interleaving
Section.helptext: Allows the enabling/disabling of node interleaving on AMD platforms.

Section.name: PCI_Bus_Padding_Option
Section.helptext: Option allows the user to disable the default PCI Bus setting where each expansion slot is provided an extra PCI Bus number. By default, the system ROM will pad one PCI bus per bridge to not affect current bus numbering schemes.

Section.name: PCI_Bus_Padding_Option_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8 servers only. Option allows the user to disable the default PCI Bus setting where each expansion slot is provided an extra PCI Bus number. By default, the system ROM will pad one PCI bus per bridge to not affect current bus numbering schemes.

Section.name: Power-on_Logo
Section.helptext: Allows disabling of HP logo at system boot.

Section.name: Hide_Option_ROM_Messages
Section.helptext: Allows disabling of Hide Option ROM Messages feature.

Section.name: Redundant_Power_Supply_Mode
Section.helptext: Allows configuring how the system will handle redundant power supply configs. Balanced mode shares the power delivery equally between installed power supplies.

Section.name: Dynamic_Power_Savings_Mode_Response
Section.helptext: Allows the system ROM to control processor performance and power state depending on the processor workload.

Section.name: Memory_Speed_with_2_DIMMs_per_Channel
Section.helptext: Allows system to run DIMMs at 1333 Mhz when up to 2 DIMMs are installed on a memory channel. Function validated with HP DIMMs. HP recommends this setting remain at the default of 1066 MHz if utilizing non HP-DIMMs.

Section.name: Video_Options
Section.helptext: By default, system ROM disables the embedded video controller when an optional video controller is detected. Option allows embedded video to remain enabled for iLO remote video.

Section.name: NIC1_Ports
Section.helptext: Option allows individual network ports to be disabled on some G6 systems.

Section.name: NIC2_Ports
Section.helptext: Option allows individual network ports to be disabled on some G6 systems.

Section.name: HyperTransport
Section.helptext: Configures HyperTransport Frequency mode on AMD processor G6 servers and older systems.

Section.name: HyperTransport_G7
Section.helptext: Configures HyperTransport Frequency mode on AMD processor G7 servers.

Section.name: Coherent_Link
Section.helptext: Sets the HyperTransport Coherent Link Option.

Section.name: Power_Supply_Requirements_Override
Section.helptext: Overrides the number of power supplies required. This setting will be ignored on the DL580 G7.

Section.name: Power_Supply_Requirements_Override_DL580G7
Section.helptext: Overrides the number of power supplies required. For use by the DL580/DL585 G7 only.

Section.name: Remote_Graphics_Mode
Section.helptext: This option redirects the video output to the embedded controller through POST when a 3rd party graphics card is installed, and auto switches to the 3rd party card during OS load. Only for ML370 G6 and ML350p Gen8.

Section.name: AMD_Ultra_Low_Power_Mode
Section.helptext: Controls the ultra low power state on AMD servers

Section.name: Hemisphere_Mode
Section.helptext: Hemisphere mode is equivalent to socket level interleaving.

Section.name: PCI_Express_Power_Management_Options
Section.helptext: This feature enables placing the PCI-e links into an idle state when the links are not being utilized.

Section.name: Intel_NIC_DMA_Channels_SE
Section.helptext: Setting NIC DMA Channels on HP SE316M1/HP SE326M1/HP SE1120/SE1220/x1600 servers.

Section.name: Collaborative_Power_Control
Section.helptext: For OSes that support the Processor Clocking Control Interface, enabling this option allows the OS to request processor frequency changes even when the server has the Power Regulator option configured for Dynamic Power Savings Mode.

Section.name: AMD_PCI_Express_Generation_20_Support
Section.helptext: Allows disabling PCI-E Gen 2.0 support on AMD based servers. If disabled, all PCI-Express devices will run at PCI-E 1.0 speeds (2.5 Gb/s) even if a PCI-E device is 2.0 capable (5.0 Gb/s).

Section.name: AMD_Minimum_Processor_Idle_Power_State
Section.helptext: Selects the lowest idle power state (C-state) the OS will use. The higher the C-state, the lower the power usage.

Section.name: AMD_Processor_Core_Disable_G7
Section.helptext: Selects the number of cores that will be enabled per processor socket on AMD G7 or later systems. The number of cores enabled per processor socket must be even (2,4,6,8,10,12).

Section.name: Processor_Core_Disable_Gen8
Section.helptext: Selects the number of cores that will be enabled per processor socket on Gen8 or later systems.

Section.name: AMD_HPC_Optimization_Mode
Section.helptext: Enables the HPC Optimization Mode on supported processors. Disabled by default.

Section.name: AMD_Core_Performance_Boost
Section.helptext: Enables AMD core performance boost on supported processors. Enabled by default.

Section.name: AMD_Memory_Interleaving
Section.helptext: Sets the memory channel mode on AMD G7 servers.

Section.name: AMD_Memory_Interleaving_Gen8
Section.helptext: Sets the memory channel mode on AMD Gen8 servers.

Section.name: AMD_Core_Select_G6
Section.helptext: Selects the number of cores that will be enabled per processor socket on AMD G6 systems.

Section.name: AMD_Memory_Channel_Mode
Section.helptext: Sets the memory channel mode on AMD G6 systems.

Section.name: Memory_Power_Capping
Section.helptext: This feature alllows configuring the memory capping.

Section.name: DIMM_Idle_Power_Saving_Mode
Section.helptext: This option provides the capability to enable or disable power throttling for the DIMMs installed in the system.

Section.name: Memory_Mapped_IO_Options
Section.helptext: This option allows configuring the system to have a total amount of 2GB of Memory Mapped I/O or 3GB of Memory Mapped I/O.

Section.name: Address_Mode_44bit
Section.helptext: Enabling this option configures the system to run in 44-bit addressing mode. This mode enables the system to run with a larger memory capacity. OS support is required.

Section.name: DCU_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: This setting is called DCU Streamer Prefetcher in RBSU on newer BIOS. System performance tuning entry.

Section.name: DCU_IP_Prefetcher
Section.helptext: This option allows the disabling of a processor prefetch feature. In very limited cases, setting this option to Disabled may improve performance. In the vast majority of cases, the default value of Enabled provides better performance.

Section.name: Data_Reuse
Section.helptext: For G7 and earlier servers only. System performance tuning entry.

Section.name: QPI_Bandwidth_Optimization
Section.helptext: The QPI link between 2 processors has been tuned to provide the best performance for all known applications.

Section.name: QPI_Bandwidth_Optimization_Gen8
Section.helptext: The QPI link between 2 processors has been tuned to provide the best performance for all known applications. For Gen8 or later servers.

Section.name: Intel_Turbo_Boost_Optimization
Section.helptext: Optimize Turbo Boost heuristics for different situations.

Section.name: HP_ProLiant_Voodoo_Technology_Processor_Core_Disable
Section.helptext: Allows disabling of processor cores using Intel's Core Multi-Processing(CMP) technology.

Section.name: HP_ProLiant_Voodoo_Technology
Section.helptext: ProLiant Voodooo Technology.

Section.name: HP_ProLiant_Voodoo_Technology_Processor_Speed
Section.helptext: Maximum Enabled Processor Frequency.

Section.name: HP_ProLiant_Voodoo_Technology_Voltage
Section.helptext: Operational Processor Voltage.

Section.name: Embedded_Serial_Port_Connector
Section.helptext: Determines how the embedded serial port connector switches to different connectors.

Section.name: Intel_Turbo_Boost_Optimization_Gen8
Section.helptext: Optimize Turbo Boost heuristics for different situations. For Gen8 or later servers only.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Embedded_Storage_Device_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 embedded storage controller (PMC control) on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Embedded_NIC_1_Device_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 embedded NIC 1 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Embedded_NIC_2_Device_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 embedded NIC 2 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_1_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 1 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_2_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 2 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_3_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 3 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_4_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 4 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_5_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 5 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_6_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 6 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_7_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 7 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_System_Specific_Device_8_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 System-Specific Device 8 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_1_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 1 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_2_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 2 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_3_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 3 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_4_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 4 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_5_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 5 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_6_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 6 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_7_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 7 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_8_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 8 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_9_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 9 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_10_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 10 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_11_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 11 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_12_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 12 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_13_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 13 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_14_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 14 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_15_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 15 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Intel_PCI_Express_Gen3_Slot_16_Control
Section.helptext: Allows enabling/disabling PCI-E Gen 3.0 Slot 16 on Intel based Gen8 servers.

Section.name: x2APIC_Options
Section.helptext: This option allows x2APIC mode to be disabled, or allows x2APIC mode to be automatically enabled if the OS supports it

Section.name: Intel_F11_Boot_Menu_Prompt
Section.helptext: This option allows the disabling of the POST One Time Boot F11 Prompt on Gen8 Servers.

Section.name: F11_Boot_Menu_Prompt_UEFI
Section.helptext: For UEFI based servers only. This option allows the disabling of the POST One Time Boot F11 Prompt.

Section.name: AMD_F11_Boot_Menu_Prompt
Section.helptext: This option allows the disabling of the POST One Time Boot F11 Prompt on Gen8 Servers.

Section.name: Intelligent_Provisioning_F10_Prompt
Section.helptext: This option allows disabling the Intelligent Provisioning functionality(F10 Prompt).

Section.name: Energy_Performance_Bias
Section.helptext: Sets the mode for the Energy/Performance Bias. For Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Energy_Performance_Bias_Gen9
Section.helptext: Sets the mode for the Energy/Performance Bias. For Gen9 servers.

Section.name: 1333_MHz_support_for_3DPC_PC3-10600H_HP_SmartMemory
Section.helptext: For Gen8 servers. Allows the enabling/disabling of 1333 MHz support for 3 DIMMs per channel for HP SmartMemory.

Section.name: System_Locality_Information_Table_G7
Section.helptext: This ACPI SLIT (System Locality Information Table) describes the relative access times between processors, memory subsystems, and I/O subsystems.

Section.name: System_Locality_Information_Table_Gen8
Section.helptext: This ACPI SLIT (System Locality Information Table) describes the relative access times between processors, memory subsystems, and I/O subsystems.

Section.name: User_Defined_Defaults
Section.helptext: For Gen8 only. This option allows saving or erasing the user defined defaults on the server.

Section.name: Intel_Memory_Channel_Mode_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8 or later systems. Combined Channel Mode provides maximum data protection by allowing multiple-bit memory errors to be corrected in certain instances not possible in normal Advanced ECC Modes.

Section.name: Dynamic_Power_Capping_Functionality
Section.helptext: This option allows the user to disable the System ROM Power Calibration feature that is executed during the boot process. When disabled, the user can expect faster boot times.

Section.name: SR-IOV
Section.helptext: This option provides the capability to enable or disable SR-IOV(Single Root I/O Virtualization).

Section.name: Network_Boot_Retry_Support
Section.helptext: This option allows the user to disable the Network Boot Retry Support. By default, the System ROM will attempt to boot the Network device (i.e. PXE device) up to 20 times before falling through to the next IPL Device.

Section.name: HP_Option_ROM_Prompting
Section.helptext: This option allows a user to disable HP Expansion Cards from delaying during POST and waiting on user input to enter Expansion Card Setup Utilities.

Section.name: Reset_on_Boot_Device_Not_Found
Section.helptext: This option controls the System ROM logic of retrying bootable devices listed in the Standard Boot Order (IPL) if no bootable media is found.

Section.name: Intel_NIC_DMA_Channels
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to enable Intel NIC DMA Channels.

Section.name: SATA_Secure_Erase
Section.helptext: This option controls whether Secure Erase functionality is supported. When enabled, the Security Freeze Lock command will not be sent to supported SATA hard drives, allowing Secure erase to function.

Section.name: AMD-Vi_IOMMU
Section.helptext: When enabled, a Virtual Machine Manager supporting this feature can utilize hardware capabilities provided by AMD's I/O Virtualization (IOMMU) functionality.

Section.name: Boot_Mode_P87
Section.helptext: Used to change between UEFI and Legacy modes.

Section.name: AHCI_Boot_Port_Selection
Section.helptext: Used to change boot port selection.

Section.name: Large_BAR_Global_Control
Section.helptext: This option provides the capability to enable or disable Large BAR Global Control.

Section.name: Consistent_Device_Naming
Section.helptext: This option selects the level of Consistent Device Naming. On supported operating systems, NIC ports will be named based on their location in the system. "CDN Support for LOMs Only" will only name Embedded NICs and FlexibleLOMs (not NICs in slots).

Section.name: ROM_Selection
Section.helptext: This option allows the server to switch back to a previous ROM image. The backup image will be the ROM image that was being used prior to the last flash event.

Section.name: Data_Direct_I/O
Section.helptext: This option controls the ability for the processor to accelerate I/O operations by reducing the number of I/O related memory accesses. This option should increase I/O performance while reducing system power and I/O latency.

Section.name: Intel_Performance_Counter_Monitor
Section.helptext: This option allows the user to unhide certain Performance Counters in the processor. When enabled, the user can use tools such as the Performance Counter Monitor (PCM).

Section.name: A7_Memory_Address_Mode
Section.helptext: This option allows the disabling of a processor memory address mode. In very limited cases, setting this option to Disabled may improve performance.

Section.name: USB_Drive_Key_Enumeration
Section.helptext: This option allows the disabling of USB drive key enumeration.

Section.name: Embedded_UEFI_Shell
Section.helptext: Enables or disables the embedded UEFI shell. Eanbling this option will allow the UEFI shell to be displayed in the boot option menu.

Section.name: UEFI_Shell_Script_Auto-Start
Section.helptext: Enables or disables automatic execution of the default UEFI script when the shell starts up.

Section.name: Add_Embedded_UEFI_Shell_to_Boot_Order
Section.helptext: Allows the Embedded UEFI Shell to be added or removed from the Boot Order.

Section.name: Boot_Mode
Section.helptext: Boot for servers that support UEFI. Allow user to change between UEFI and Legacy mode.

Section.name: UEFI_Optimized_Boot
Section.helptext: Only valid if Boot_Mode is set to UEFI_Mode. Set this to Disabled if installing Windows 2008/R2.

Section.name: UEFI_PXE_Boot_Policy
Section.helptext: Sets the UEFI PXE Boot Policy for IPv4 and IPv6.

Section.name: Boot_Order_Policy
Section.helptext: Sets the policy for the way the server tries to boot devices.

Section.name: Processor_X2Apic_Support
Section.helptext: This option lets you enable support for processor X2Apic devices.

Section.name: ACPI_RASF_Table_Support
Section.helptext: This option lets you enable the ACPI RASF table. Enabling this option generates the ACPI RASF table.

Section.name: ACPI_Root_Bridge_PXM_Preferences
Section.helptext: This option is now called Memory Proximity Reporting for I/O. If enabled, the System ROM reports the proximity relationship between I/O devices and system memory to the operating system.

Section.name: PCI_Express_64-Bit_BAR_Support
Section.helptext: This option lets you force PCIe resources to use 32-bit MMIO addressing. Disabling 64-Bit BAR support might be necessary for certain legacy Option Card devices to function properly when the Boot Mode is set to Legacy Boot.

Section.name: Enhanced_System_Boot_Memory_RAS
Section.helptext: For Gen9, this is called Extended Memory Test. Enabling this option results in the system validating memory during the memory initialization process.

Section.name: Hyperthreading_DL580Gen8
Section.helptext: Toggles hyperthreading on the DL580 Gen8 server.

Section.name: QPI_Snoop_Configuration
Section.helptext: Note: "Standard" is the same "Home Snoop". This option allows for the configurations of different snoop modes that impact the QPI interconnect. Changing this option may improve performance in certain workloads.

Section.name: USB_3.0_Mode
Section.helptext: This option lets you configurate the operating mode of the USB 3.0 (XHCI) Controller.

Section.name: Video_Options_Gen9
Section.helptext: This option lets you configure video settings in the system.

Section.name: Embedded_Video_Connection
Section.helptext: This option lets you configure embedded video connection in the system.

Section.name: Power_Supply_Requirements_Override_DL580Gen8
Section.helptext: Overrides the number of power supplies required. For use by the DL580 Gen8 and Gen9 only.

Section.name: Channel_Interleaving_Gen8
Section.helptext: For Gen8 and later. This option lets you modify the level of interleaving for which the memory system is configured.

Section.name: Embedded_User_Partition
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the Embedded User Partition.

Section.name: Memory_Proximity_Reporting_for_I/O
Section.helptext: If enabled, the System ROM reports the proximity relationship between I/O devices and system memory to the operating system.

Section.name: Embedded_Diagnostics
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable Embedded Diagnostics functionality.

Section.name: Embedded_Diagnostics_Mode
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure Embedded diagnostics mode.

Section.name: Embedded_Diagnostics_Selection
Section.helptext: This option allows you to select Embedded Diagnostics to be launched from NAND or from ROM.

Section.name: Memory_Fast_Training
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure memory training on server reboots. This improves the server boot time.

Section.name: Fan_Installation_Requirements
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the server reacts when all required fans are not installed.

Section.name: Fan_Failure_Policy
Section.helptext: Use this option to configure how the server reacts when fans fail resulting in the server not having required fans in operation.

Section.name: Extended_Ambient_Temperature_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable the server to operate at higher ambient temperatures than normally supported.

Section.name: ACPI_RTC_Support
Section.helptext: This option controls whether industry standard ACPI tables communicate that the operating system is allowed to directly use the RTC for date/time information.

Section.name: Mixed_Power_Supply_Reporting
Section.helptext: When enabled, the server logs a message that a mixed power supply configuration is present.

Section.name: Intel_TXT_Support_Gen8
Section.helptext: Gen8 only. Intel(R) TXT requires that all processor cores are enabled, Hyperthreading is enabled, VT-d is enabled, and TPM is enabled. Disabling any of these features while TXT is enabled can prevent TXT from working properly.

Section.name: Intel_TXT_Support_Gen9
Section.helptext: Gen9 only. Intel(R) TXT requires that all processor cores are enabled, Hyperthreading is enabled, VT-d is enabled, and TPM is enabled. Disabling any of these features while TXT is enabled can prevent TXT from working properly.

Section.name: Intel_QPI_Link_Enablement
Section.helptext: This option allows user to configure the QPI topology to use fewer links between processors when available.

Section.name: NUMA_Group_Size_Optimization
Section.helptext: This option allows the user to configure how the System ROM reports the size of a NUMA node (number of logical processors) to assist the Operating System in grouping processors for application use.

Section.name: PCI_Device_Disable_Embedded_Mezz
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling PCI devices. Embedded and Blade Mezzanine card are included in this section. Different bit for each device. 0=Enabled. 1=Disabled.

Section.name: PCI_Device_Disable_SATA_Slots
Section.helptext: Raw data bytes that include data for disabling PCI devices. SATA Controllers and PCIe Slots are included in this section. Different bit for each device. 0=Enabled. 1=Disabled.

Section.name: Processor_AES-NI_Support
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Advanced Encryption Standard Instruction Set (AES-NI) in the processor.

Section.name: Internal_SD_Card_Slot
Section.helptext: Use this option to enable or disable the Internal SD Card Slot. When set to disabled, the SD card slot is disabled regardless of whether an SD Card is installed or not.

Section.name: UEFI_Graphics_Output
Section.helptext: Use this option to disable UEFI Graphics Output console on the system.

Section.name: I/O_Non-posted_Prefetching
Section.helptext: For Gen9 and later. Disabling non-posted prefetching for I/O can significantly improve performance for a small set of configurations that require a balanced mix of read/write I/O traffic.

Section.name: IPv6_DHCP_Unique_Identifier
Section.helptext: Use this option to control the IPv6 DHCP Unique Identifier (DUID).

Section.name: Intel_DMI_Link_Frequency
Section.helptext: Use this option to force the link speed between the processor and southbridge to run at slower speeds to save power.

Section.name: PowerMonitoring
Section.helptext: This setting determines if Pstate logging and utilization is supported.

Section.name: DisableMemoryPrefailureNotification
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to disable Memory Pre-Failure Notification support, which will remove the periodic SMI associated with this support. Not recommended for anyone except for those who absolutely need every periodic SMI removed.

Section.name: Memory_Refresh_Rate_Gen9
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to change the Memory Refresh Rate setting on Gen9 servers.

Section.name: Memory_Refresh_Gen8
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to change the Memory Refresh setting on Gen8 servers.

Section.name: Memory_Double_Refresh_DL580G7
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to change the Memory Double Refresh setting on the DL580 G7 server.

Section.name: Memory_Patrol_Scrubbing_DL580G7
Section.helptext: This setting allows the user to change the Memory Patrol Scrubbing setting on the DL580 G7 server.
